title: Harlan Crow, Other Billionaires Donate to DeSantis Campaign
description: Florida Governor Ron DeSantis’s campaign can count billionaire real estate developer Harlan Crow among a list of wealthy donors who are supporting his campaign.

title: UK’s Ben Wallace to Resign as Defense Secretary, Times Says
description: UK Defense Secretary Ben Wallace said he will step down during the next reshuffling of Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s cabinet, the London-based Times reported.

title: Who’s Winning the Money Race for President as Campaigns Heat Up
description: The race for presidential hopefuls to lure donors and build up their bank accounts is in full swing as Republican contenders bulk up their campaigns for a long, competitive primary and President Joe Biden prepares for the general election.

title: UK’s Shapps to Grill Top Grocers, Energy Firms Over Fuel Prices
description: UK Energy Minister Grant Shapps is set to meet with the heads of Britain’s biggest supermarkets and energy firms amid worries that waning competition is contributing to higher fuel prices for drivers.

title: Israel’s Netanyahu in ‘Good Condition,’ Undergoing Medical Tests
description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is in “good condition” after being taken to the hospital on Saturday, his office said.

title: Free Money Is the Latest Strategy for GOP Presidential Campaigns
description: The political fundraising appeal has been completely reversed: Some long-shot Republican presidential candidates will now give you money.

title: Rahul Gandhi Challenges Conviction Ruling in India’s Top Court
description: Indian opposition leader Rahul Gandhi approached the country’s top court to challenge the refusal to suspend his defamation conviction, which may bar him from contesting elections next year.

title: Diplomatic Breakthrough at NATO, Heat Waves: Weekend Reads
description: After months of diplomatic wrangling, Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan agreed to support Sweden’s bid to join NATO in a major breakthrough for the military alliance’s drive to strengthen its defenses in the wake of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.

title: Your Saturday UK Briefing: Wimbledon’s Historic Final as Sunak Eyes Inflation
description: Follow us at  @BloombergUK and on  Facebook, and wrap up your day with The Readout newsletter.

title: G-20 Host India Seeks Bilaterals for Consensus Language on War
description: The Group of Twenty countries’ leaders won’t come together to discuss the language describing Russia’s war in Ukraine, with host India shifting to one-on-one discussions in an attempt to get an agreement.

title: UK Defence Secretary Ben Wallace Is Said to Consider Quitting
description: UK Defense Secretary Ben Wallace may step down ahead of an expected autumn reshuffle of Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s cabinet being done with an eye toward the 2023 election, the Times reported.

title: UK Government Considers Scrapping Inheritance Tax, Times Says
description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s government is in talks about abolishing the UK’s inheritance tax ahead of the next general election, the Times reported, without saying how it got the information.

title: Ex-GIC Investment Boss Ng Mulls Bid for Singapore Presidency
description: Ng Kok Song, the former chief investment officer of Singapore sovereign wealth fund GIC Pte, is considering standing in the city-state’s upcoming presidential election.

title: Thai PM Frontrunner Pita Opens Door For Pheu Thai-Led Government
description: Thailand’s frontrunner for prime minister Pita Limjaroenrat said he is willing to step aside and let his coalition partner Pheu Thai party form the next government, should he fail in his attempts to secure the country’s top political office.

title: South Korean President Yoon Visits Ukraine, to Meet Zelenskiy
description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol made a surprise trip to Ukraine and is expected to meet Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy.

title: Ukraine Recap: S. Korean President Makes Surprise Visit to Kyiv
description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol arrived in Kyiv on Saturday and will meet with President Volodymyr Zelenskiy, his office said. The previously unannounced visit follows Yoon’s attendance at the NATO summit in Lithuania and an official stop in Poland.

title: Germans Aren’t Buying Scholz’s Plan to Keep Them Safe and Rich
description: Chancellor Olaf Scholz is struggling to persuade Germans he can handle the litany of troubles looming over the country he has led since 2021.

title: Sunak Officials Play Down Talk of Cooling Prices Before Key Week
description: After watching British prices surge faster than expected for four straight months, Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s team isn’t getting its hopes up about a change in fortunes next week.

title: Turkey Parliament Recess No Barrier to Debate Sweden’s NATO Bid
description: Turkey’s Parliament has enabled its foreign affairs committee to work during its more than two-month summer recess that started on Saturday, allowing the country to speed up its ratification process of Sweden’s membership in NATO.

title: War, Debt Distress, Inflation: G-20 Finance Chiefs Spar in India
description: The finance and central bank chiefs of the world’s largest economies will debate the risks of Russia’s prolonged war in Ukraine and yet another shift to resuming interest rate hikes in meetings next week in Gandhinagar, India.

title: Hong Kong Condemns US Bill That Could Close Its Trade Offices
description: Hong Kong has condemned a US Senate Committee for passing a bill that could shut down the city’s three economic and trade offices in America if the financial hub isn’t deemed significantly autonomous from Beijing.

title: Miami’s Suarez Raises $1 Million, But PACs Boost White House Bid
description: Miami Mayor Francis Suarez raised nearly $1 million in the first two weeks of his campaign for the presidency, but the real strength in his bid is in the more than $12 million generated by two super political action committees supporting his candidacy.

title: Chip Leaders Head to Washington to Lobby for China Rules Relief
description: America’s largest semiconductor companies are embarking on a last-ditch effort to head off new curbs on their sales to China, with senior executives traveling to Washington next week for talks with administration officials and lawmakers.
